intro: Ruellia devosiana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia devosiana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
